cookingMethod: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour a 9-inch springform pan. In a large bowl, cream together the cream cheese and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the sour cream. Fold in the graham cracker crumbs. Pour the batter into the prepared pan and bake for 60-70 minutes, or until the center is set. Let cool completely before removing from the pan.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Cook macaroni according to package directions. Meanwhile, melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Whisk in flour until smooth. Gradually whisk in milk until thickened. Stir in cheeses and season with salt and pepper to taste. Drain macaroni and add to cheese sauce. Pour into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish. Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until golden brown.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Dip chicken breasts in flour, then egg, then bread crumbs. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Fry chicken until golden brown and cooked through, about 5 minutes per side. Drain on paper towels. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Roll out pizza dough into a 12-inch circle. Spread pizza sauce over dough, leaving a 1-inch border. Sprinkle with cheese and toppings. Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until crust is golden brown and cheese is melted and bubbly.

Preheat grill to medium heat. In a bowl, combine ground beef, breadcrumbs, egg, ketchup, mustard, and salt and pepper to taste. Shape into patties. Grill burgers for 3-4 minutes per side, or until cooked through. Serve on buns with your favorite toppings.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Whisk in heavy cream until thickened. Stir in Parmesan cheese, garlic powder, and black pepper to taste. Add cooked chicken and heat through. Serve immediately.

Brown ground beef in a large skillet over medium heat. Drain excess grease. Stir in taco seasoning mix and cook according to package directions. Serve on tortillas with sour cream, cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, and guacamole.
Combine tuna, mayo, celery, onion, salt, and pepper in a bowl. Mix well. Serve on bread or crackers.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Cook chicken in a large pot over medium heat until cooked through. Remove from heat and shred. Add carrots, peas, onion, and celery to the pot and cook until softened. Stir in chicken broth, cream of chicken soup, salt, and pepper. Pour into a pie crust. Top with another pie crust and seal the edges. Bake for 45 minutes, or until crust is golden brown.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Cook ground beef in a large skillet over medium heat until cooked through. Drain excess grease. Spread a thin layer of tomato sauce in the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish. Layer with lasagna noodles, ground beef, ricotta cheese, mozzarella cheese, and Parmesan cheese. Repeat layers. Pour remaining tomato sauce over the top. Bake for 30 minutes, or until cheese is melted and bubbly.
Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat. Add chicken breast and cook until browned on all sides. Add vegetables and cook until softened. Serve over rice or noodles.

Brown beef sirloin tips in a large skillet over medium heat. Drain excess grease. Add mushrooms and onion and cook until softened. Stir in sour cream, cream of mushroom soup, salt, and pepper. Cook until heated through. Serve over noodles.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Dredge cod fillets in all-purpose flour, then egg wash, then breadcrumbs. Fry in hot oil until golden brown and cooked through. Serve with tartar sauce and fries.

Cook rice noodles according to package directions. Meanwhile, heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and cook until fragrant. Add shrimp and chicken and cook until cooked through. Add noodles, soy sauce, lime juice, and sugar. Toss to coat. Serve immediately with peanuts.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Roll out pizza dough into a 12-inch circle. Spread tomato sauce over dough, leaving a 1-inch border. Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese and basil leaves. Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until crust is golden brown and cheese is melted and bubbly.

Cook rice according to package directions. Let cool slightly. Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add vegetables and cook until softened. Add eggs and cook until scrambled. Add rice and soy sauce, salt, and pepper. Cook until heated through.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook until softened. Add ginger and garlic and cook for 1 minute more. Stir in curry powder and cook for 1 minute more. Add tomato sauce, coconut milk, chicken, salt, and pepper. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through.

Heat oil in a large Dutch oven over medium heat. Add beef and cook until browned on all sides. Remove from the pot and set aside. Add carrots, onions, and mushrooms to the pot and cook until softened. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute more. Stir in herbs de Provence, tomato paste, and beef broth. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 2 hours, or until beef is tender. Return beef to the pot and cook for 30 minutes more.

Cook lasagna noodles according to package directions. Meanwhile, brown ground beef in a large pot over medium heat. Drain excess grease. Add tomato sauce, ricotta cheese, mozzarella cheese, Parmesan cheese, and vegetables. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes, or until heated through. Serve with additional Parmesan cheese.

Cook chicken breast in a large pot over medium heat until cooked through. Remove from the pot and shred. Add tortilla chips, shredded cheese, sour cream, cilantro, lime juice, and vegetables to the pot. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes, or until heated through. Serve with additional tortilla chips and cheese.
Marinade pork shoulder in adobo sauce overnight. Cook pork shoulder in a slow cooker on low for 8 hours, or until tender. Shred pork and serve with tortillas, cilantro, onions, and limes.
Preheat grill to medium heat. Brush salmon fillets with olive oil and season with herbs of your choice. Grill for 5-7 minutes per side, or until cooked through.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add shrimp and cook until pink and opaque. Remove from the skillet and set aside. Add garlic to the skillet and cook until fragrant. Add white wine and cook until reduced by half. Stir in butter, lemon juice, and parsley. Return shrimp to the skillet and cook until heated through.

Cook spaghetti according to package directions. Meanwhile, cook bacon in a large skillet over medium heat until crisp. Remove bacon from the skillet and set aside. Drain all but 2 tablespoons of the bacon fat from the skillet. Add eggs, Parmesan cheese, and black pepper to the skillet and whisk until smooth. Add cooked spaghetti to the skillet and toss to coat. Stir in bacon and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Pound beef tenderloin to 1/2-inch thickness. Spread mushroom duxelles over beef and top with ham. Roll up beef and wrap in puff pastry. Seal the edges with a fork. Bake for 30 minutes, or until pastry is golden brown and beef is cooked to desired doneness.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). In a medium saucepan, combine heavy cream, sugar, and vanilla extract. Bring to a simmer over medium heat, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and let cool slightly. In a separate bowl, whisk together egg yolks. Gradually whisk in hot cream mixture. Pour mixture into 6 ramekins. Place ramekins in a baking dish and fill with hot water until halfway up the sides of the ramekins. Bake for 30 minutes, or until custard is set. Let cool completely, then chill for at least 2 hours. Sprinkle with sugar and caramelize with a blowtorch.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). On a lightly floured surface, roll out one pie crust into a 12-inch circle. Transfer to a 9-inch pie plate. In a large bowl, combine apples, sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Pour into prepared pie crust. Top with second pie crust and crimp edges to seal. Cut several slits in the top crust to allow steam to escape. Bake for 45-50 minutes, or until crust is golden brown and filling is bubbling. Let cool completely before serving.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Cut puff pastry sheets into 4 equal pieces. Place each piece in a ramekin. Spoon chocolate ganache into the center of each pastry. Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until pastry is golden brown and chocolate is melted. Serve immediately.

Dip ladyfingers in coffee until soaked. Layer ladyfingers in a dish. In a separate bowl, combine sugar and mascarpone cheese. Beat until smooth. Fold in whipped cream. Spread mixture over ladyfingers. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a food processor, crush graham crackers into fine crumbs. Add melted butter and mix until well combined. Press crumb mixture into the bottom of a 9-inch pie plate. Bake for 10 minutes, or until crust is set. In a medium bowl, whisk together lime juice, condensed milk, and egg yolks. Pour mixture into prepared crust. Bake for 15 minutes, or until set. Let cool completely before serving.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Cream together the butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the vanilla. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, and salt. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined. Stir in the chocolate chips. Drop by rounded tablespoons onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until golden brown. Let cool on baking sheets for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

Prepare cake mix according to package directions, substituting buttermilk for the water and adding red food coloring to the batter. Pour batter into a greased and floured 9x13 inch baking pan. Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Let cool completely before frosting. Frost with cream cheese frosting.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a food processor, crush graham crackers into fine crumbs. Press crumb mixture into the bottom of a 9-inch springform pan. Bake for 10 minutes, or until crust is set. In a large bowl, beat cream cheese and sugar until smooth. Beat in eggs one at a time, then stir in sour cream and vanilla extract. Pour mixture into prepared crust. Bake for 50-60 minutes, or until set. Let cool completely before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a muffin tin with paper liners. In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt. In a separate bowl, cream together the sugar and butter until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the vanilla extract. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined. Fill each muffin liner 2/3 full of batter. Bake for 18-22 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Let cool completely before frosting.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour an 8x8 inch baking pan. In a medium bowl, whisk together the cocoa powder, flour, baking powder, and salt. In a separate bowl, cream together the sugar and butter until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the vanilla extract. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined. Pour batter into prepared pan. Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Let cool completely before cutting into squares.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Make the shortbread crust: In a food processor, combine flour, sugar, and salt. Cut in butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Press crumb mixture into the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking pan. Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until golden brown. Make the lemon curd: In a medium saucepan, whisk together eggs, sugar, lemon juice, and salt. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture thickens and coats the back of a spoon. Pour lemon curd over the cooled shortbread crust. Let cool completely before cutting into bars.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Cream together the butter, peanut butter, and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the vanilla extract. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined. Drop by rounded tablespoons onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until golden brown. Let cool on baking sheets for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, ginger, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, baking soda, and salt. In a separate bowl, cream together the butter and brown sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the molasses. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined. Chill dough for at least 30 minutes. Roll out dough on a lightly floured surface to 1/4-inch thickness. Cut out cookies with desired shapes. Place cookies on ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until golden brown. Let cool on baking sheets for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Cream together the sugar and butter until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the vanilla extract. Gradually add the flour to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined. Chill dough for at least 30 minutes. Roll out dough on a lightly floured surface to 1/4-inch thickness. Cut out cookies with desired shapes. Place cookies on ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until golden brown. Let cool on baking sheets for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a food processor, combine flour, sugar, and salt. Cut in butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Press crumb mixture into the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking pan. Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until golden brown. Let cool completely before cutting into bars.

Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. In a food processor, combine almond flour and powdered sugar. Pulse until well combined. Sift the mixture into a bowl. In a separate bowl, beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. Gradually add granulated sugar, beating until stiff peaks form again. Fold in almond flour mixture until just combined. Add food coloring, if desired. Pipe batter onto prepared baking sheet. Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until macarons are set. Let cool completely on baking sheet before removing.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). In a large bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, and salt. Cut in butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in milk until just combined. Drop by rounded tablespoons onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until golden brown. Let cool on baking sheets for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Cook macaroni according to package directions. Meanwhile, melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Whisk in flour until smooth. Gradually whisk in milk until thickened. Stir in cheeses and season with salt and pepper to taste. Drain macaroni and add to cheese sauce. Pour into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish. Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until golden brown.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Cream together the butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the vanilla. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, and salt. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined. Stir in the chocolate chips. Drop by rounded tablespoons onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until golden brown. Let cool on baking sheets for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.
